## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I'm interested in learning more about creating a chain on Verus. What happens if the minimum contributions are not met?

**AI Assistant:**
Good question! If the minimum contributions are not met, the chain will fail to start and all contributions can be spent back to the original contributors. So, it's important to ensure that you have enough support and contributions to meet the minimum requirements.

**User:**
I've been looking at some chain definition examples, and I had a question about the conversion price. Does the chain definition example convert all contributions to the native chain currency at a 50%, 2:1 conversion price?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, no. The example chain definition actually converts all contributions to the native chain currency at a 100%, 1:1 conversion price. So, it's a straightforward one-to-one conversion. Do you have any more questions about chain definitions or creating a chain on Verus?
What happens if the minimum contributions are not met?
If the minimum contributions are not met, the chain will fail to start and all contributions can be spent back to the original contributors.

**Sample chain definition:**
```
./verusd -chain=VRSCTEST definechain '{"name":"RESERVEWITHPREMINE","paymentaddress":"R9LkTaMn1XpjeorE4RjM6pMcy5Nxkx9jPM","premine":50000000000000,"initialcontribution":5000000000000,"conversion":100000000,"minpreconvert":45000000000000,"maxpreconvert":100000000000000,"launchfee":0,"billingperiod":14400,"notarizationreward":100000000000,"eras":[{"reward":5000000000,"decay":0,"halving":0,"eraend":0,"eraoptions":1}],"nodes":[{"networkaddress":"ipaddress:port","paymentaddress":"R9LkTaMn1XpjeorE4RjM6pMcy5Nxkx9jPM"},
{"networkaddress":"2ndipaddress:port","paymentaddress":"R9LkTaMn1XpjeorE4RjM6pMcy5Nxkx9jPM"}]}'
```The example above defines a chain that emits a premine to the indicated address and also converts all contributions up to a maximum amount to the native chain currency at launch at a 100%, 1:1 conversion price. All contributions will enter the currency's reserve deposits, and the more contributions on this chain, the higher the starting reserve ratio will be. If the minimum contributions are not met, the chain will fail to start and all contributions can be spent back to the original contributors.
Does the chain definition example convert all contributions to the native chain currency at a 50%, 2:1 conversion price?
No, the example chain definition actually converts all contributions to the native chain currency at a 100%, 1:1 conversion price.

**Sample chain definition:**
```
./verusd -chain=VRSCTEST definechain '{"name":"RESERVEWITHPREMINE","paymentaddress":"R9LkTaMn1XpjeorE4RjM6pMcy5Nxkx9jPM","premine":50000000000000,"initialcontribution":5000000000000,"conversion":100000000,"minpreconvert":45000000000000,"maxpreconvert":100000000000000,"launchfee":0,"billingperiod":14400,"notarizationreward":100000000000,"eras":[{"reward":5000000000,"decay":0,"halving":0,"eraend":0,"eraoptions":1}],"nodes":[{"networkaddress":"ipaddress:port","paymentaddress":"R9LkTaMn1XpjeorE4RjM6pMcy5Nxkx9jPM"},
{"networkaddress":"2ndipaddress:port","paymentaddress":"R9LkTaMn1XpjeorE4RjM6pMcy5Nxkx9jPM"}]}'
```The example above defines a chain that emits a premine to the indicated address and also converts all contributions up to a maximum amount to the native chain currency at launch at a 100%, 1:1 conversion price. All contributions will enter the currency's reserve deposits, and the more contributions on this chain, the higher the starting reserve ratio will be. If the minimum contributions are not met, the chain will fail to start and all contributions can be spent back to the original contributors.
